question: A 75-year-old male with a terminal illness has died at home. As you and your partner enter the residence, a family member becomes verbally abusive, pushes you, and states that you took too long to get there. You should:
answers: tell the family member that it is not your fault.
retreat and notify law enforcement personnel.
subdue the family member until the police arrive.
ignore the family member and assess the patient.
correctAnswers: retreat and notify law enforcement personnel.
selectedAnswer: retreat and notify law enforcement personnel.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: According to Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) regulations, an employer must:
answers: provide gloves and other personal protective equipment to full-time paid employees only.
guarantee a 100% risk-free environment prior to employment.
offer a workplace environment that reduces the risk of exposure.
screen all prospective employees for bloodborne pathogens.
correctAnswers: offer a workplace environment that reduces the risk of exposure.
selectedAnswer: offer a workplace environment that reduces the risk of exposure.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: A critical incident stress debriefing should be conducted no longer than ________ hours following the incident.
answers: six
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: After assessing a patient's blood glucose level, you accidentally stick yourself with the contaminated lancet. You should:
answers: report the incident to your supervisor after the call.
immerse your wound in an alcohol-based solution.
discontinue patient care and seek medical attention.
get immunized against hepatitis as soon as possible.
correctAnswers: report the incident to your supervisor after the call.
selectedAnswer: discontinue patient care and seek medical attention.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: A positive TB skin test indicates that:
answers: you have been exposed to TB.
the TB disease is currently dormant but might later become active.
you are actively infected with TB.
you have never been exposed to TB.
correctAnswers: you have been exposed to TB.
selectedAnswer: you have been exposed to TB.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: As an EMT, it is important to remember that the signs and symptoms of cumulative stress:
answers: usually manifest suddenly and without warning.
might not be obvious or present all the time.
cannot be identified and can cause health problems.
are most effectively treated with medications.
correctAnswers: might not be obvious or present all the time.
selectedAnswer: might not be obvious or present all the time.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: At the scene of an automobile crash, a utility pole has been broken, and power lines are lying across the car. The patients inside the car are conscious. You should:
answers: mark off a danger zone around the downed lines.
remove the lines with a nonconductive object.
proceed with normal extrication procedures.
advise the patients to carefully get out of the car.
correctAnswers: mark off a danger zone around the downed lines.
selectedAnswer: mark off a danger zone around the downed lines.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Carbon monoxide blocks the ability of the blood to oxygenate the body because it:
answers: fills the alveoli in the lungs with thick secretions.
destroys the number of circulating red blood cells.
causes the body to expel too much carbon dioxide.
binds with the hemoglobin in red blood cells.
correctAnswers: binds with the hemoglobin in red blood cells.
selectedAnswer: binds with the hemoglobin in red blood cells.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Critical incident stress management (CISM) can occur at an ongoing scene in all of the following circumstances, except:
answers: when personnel are assessed during periods of rest.
before leaving the scene after the incident is resolved.
before personnel are preparing to reenter the scene.
when patients are actively being assessed or treated.
correctAnswers: when patients are actively being assessed or treated.
selectedAnswer: when patients are actively being assessed or treated.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Gloves, a mask, eye protection, and a face shield should be used:
answers: during routine cleaning of the ambulance.
while handling needles or other sharps.
whenever you touch non-intact skin.
when performing endotracheal intubation.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: If it is not possible to adequately clean your ambulance at the hospital following a call, you should:
answers: wait until the end of your shift and then disinfect the entire patient compartment.
quickly wipe down all high-contact surfaces with an antibacterial solution.
clean the ambulance at your station in a designated area that is well ventilated.
thoroughly wash the back of the ambulance at a local car wash or similar facility.
correctAnswers: clean the ambulance at your station in a designated area that is well ventilated.
selectedAnswer: clean the ambulance at your station in a designated area that is well ventilated.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: If you are exposed to a patient's blood or other bodily fluid, your first action should be to:
answers: abandon patient care and seek medical attention.
report the incident to the infection control officer.
transfer care of the patient to another EMS provider.
vigorously clean the area with soap and water.
correctAnswers: transfer care of the patient to another EMS provider.
selectedAnswer: transfer care of the patient to another EMS provider.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: If you use a waterless handwashing substitute in the field, it is important to:
answers: wait at least five minutes before touching another patient.
wash your hands with soap and water at the hospital.
avoid donning another pair of gloves for at least 10 minutes.
immediately dry your hands with a paper towel.
correctAnswers: wash your hands with soap and water at the hospital.
selectedAnswer: wash your hands with soap and water at the hospital.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Prescription glasses do not provide adequate eye protection because they:
answers: are not secured with a strap.
offer little or no side protection.
do not have shatterproof lenses.
have large, rounded lenses.
correctAnswers: offer little or no side protection.
selectedAnswer: offer little or no side protection.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: The capacity of an individual to cope with and recover from stress is called:
answers: wellness.
distress.
eustress.
resilience.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: The simplest, yet most effective method of preventing the spread of an infectious disease is to:
answers: undergo annual testing for tuberculosis and hepatitis.
wash your hands in between patient contacts.
ensure that your immunizations are up-to-date.
undergo an annual physical examination.
correctAnswers: wash your hands in between patient contacts.
selectedAnswer: wash your hands in between patient contacts.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Vector-borne transmission of an infectious organism occurs via:
answers: smoke or dust.
inanimate objects.
direct contact.
animals or insects.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: When decontaminating the back of your ambulance after a call, you should:
answers: allow surfaces to air dry unless otherwise indicated in the product directions.
spray the contaminated areas and then immediately wipe them dry with a towel.
clean all surfaces and patient contact areas with a mixture of alcohol and water.
use a bleach and water solution at a 1:2 dilution ratio to thoroughly wipe all surfaces.
correctAnswers: allow surfaces to air dry unless otherwise indicated in the product directions.
selectedAnswer: allow surfaces to air dry unless otherwise indicated in the product directions.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Which of the following is an effective stress management strategy?
answers: Developing a social network outside of EMS
Requesting overtime to occupy your mind
Modestly increasing caffeine consumption
Frequently reflecting on troublesome calls
correctAnswers: Developing a social network outside of EMS
selectedAnswer: Developing a social network outside of EMS
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Which of the following scenarios most accurately depicts a posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) reaction?
answers: A newly certified EMT becomes extremely nauseated and diaphoretic at the scene of an incident involving grotesque injuries.
An EMT is emotionally exhausted and depressed after a school bus crash involving critical injuries and the death of several children.
An EMT with many years of field experience becomes irritable with her coworkers and experiences headaches and insomnia.
An EMT becomes distracted at the scene of a motor vehicle crash involving the same type of car in which a child was previously killed.
correctAnswers: An EMT becomes distracted at the scene of a motor vehicle crash involving the same type of car in which a child was previously killed.
selectedAnswer: An EMT becomes distracted at the scene of a motor vehicle crash involving the same type of car in which a child was previously killed.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)
